quizzes.question: The values of the "visibility" property are:
quizzes.textContent:
[h1]The visibility Property[/h1] The [b]visibility [/b]property specifies whether an element is visible or hidden. The most common values are [b]visible [/b]and [b]hidden[/b]. Hiding an element can be done by setting the display property to "none" or the visibility property to "hidden". However, notice that these two methods produce different results: [b]visibility:hidden[/b] hides an element, but it will still take up the same space as before. The element will be hidden, but it will still affect the layout: Here is an example: [b]The HTML:[/b][code format="html" ]

This is a heading

This text will not display in browser.

The space above this paragraph is empty because the visibility of the div element is set to hidden.

[/code] [b]The CSS:[/b][code format="css" codeId="565"]div.hidden { [b] visibility: hidden[/b]; }[/code] [b]Result:[/b] [img id="2650" width="100%"] [b]display:none[/b] hides an element, without holding a place for that element. Changing [b]visibility: hidden; [/b]to [b]display: none; [/b]will produce the following result:[code format="css" codeId="566"]div.hidden { [b]display: none[/b]; }[/code] [b]Result:[/b] [img id="2651" width="100%"]
